name: Create a Tag Object
description: Note that creating a tag object does not create the reference that makes a tag in Git. If you want to create an annotated tag in Git, you have to do this call to create the tag object, and then [create](/v3/git/refs/#create-a-reference) the `refs/tags/[tag]` reference. If you want to create a lightweight tag, you only have to [create](/v3/git/refs/#create-a-reference) the tag reference - this call would be unnecessary.

params.name: object
params.description: The SHA of the git object this is tagging

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the object we're tagging. Normally this is a `commit` but it can also be a `tree` or a `blob`.

params.name: tagger
params.description: An object with information about the individual creating the tag.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the author of the tag

params.name: email
params.description: The email of the author of the tag

params.name: date
params.description: When this object was tagged. This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: verified
params.description: Does GitHub consider the signature in this tag to be verified?

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason for `verified` value. Possible values and their meanings are enumerated in the table below.

params.name: signature
params.description: The signature that was extracted from the tag.
